result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaray Lamar Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges and provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. To be paid within 90 days from today's date. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail on deposit to apply.
Credit for 40 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor and his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaray Lamar Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment; filed.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; filed.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court ordered defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction, with 40 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant to pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges - to be paid within 90 days from today's date.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

* Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge - to be paid within 90 days from today's date.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2017 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Elizabeth Kulinski appeared under the student practice rule for the State of Wisconsin.   Michael Christopher Schindhelm supervising.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
While court was attempting to go through the plea colloquy with the defendant, Court finds that it cannot accept defendant's plea.
Court scheduled this matter for trial.

Case adjourned to 06-26-2017 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Jury Trial.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for status of defendant retaining private counsel.
Defendant has not retained private counsel.
Atty. Sargent will remain as counsel of record for the defendant.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.

Case adjourned to 04-11-2017 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Status Conference held.
Defendant has not yet retained private counsel "again".
Court admonished defendant and advised him that this is the last adjournment the Court will allow for retaining new counsel.

Case adjourned to 03-13-2017 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status of Counsel.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S STATUS CONFERENCE OFF THE RECORD.

Defendant has not yet privately retained new counsel.
Atty. Sargent is to remain on this case until the issue regarding new counsel is resolved.
Case adjourned to 02-23-2017 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Defendant plans to retain private counsel.
Statements made.
Court gives defendant an opportunity to retain private counsel, however, does NOT release Atty. Steven Sargent as counsel for the defendant at this time.

Case adjourned to 02-14-2017 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Defendant needs more time to become compliant.
Case adjourned to 01-11-2017 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed./ds

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant called Attorney Thomas and states he was at the hospital with his grandmother and could not appear this morning.  Attorney Thomas asks for a stayed bench warrant.  Court denies motion and orders the bench warrant to remain outstanding.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith not in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  

State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Jaray Lamar Smith in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/3/15.
